name: Abolish
text:
You may discard a Plains card rather than pay Abolish's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
originalText:
You may discard a plains from your hand instead of paying Abolish's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: As war raged on, the young mages became more direct in their tactics, often at great cost.

text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Go ahead. Take it. You'll be so very powerful . . . and what harm can it do?"
originalText: {1}{B}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
name: Agent of Shauku
Alexi's Cloak

rulings.text: Any Auras already on the creature remain.

text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
originalText:
You may play Alexi's Cloak any time you could play an instant.
Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.

"Doesn't look like much, does it?"
—Alexi, zephyr mage

text: {X}{U}, {T}, Discard two cards: Return X target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: The Keldons didn't know her name, but they still cursed her in battle.

Aura Fracture
text: Sacrifice a land: Destroy target enchantment.
originalText: Sacrifice a land: Destroy target enchantment.

name: Barbed Field

rulings.text: Land are normally colorless, so effects that care about the color of the damage's source will not find a color.

text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: This land deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
originalText: Enchanted land has "{T}: This land deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
flavor: Wherever they went, the Keldons transformed the land into a weapon.

name: Blessed Wind

rulings.text: This counts as gaining or losing life as appropriate.

text: Target player's life total becomes 20.
originalText: Target player's life total becomes 20.
flavor:
"The fourth wind of ascension is Anointer, deifying the worthy."
—Keld Triumphant

text:
Protection from white
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Bog Elemental unless you sacrifice a land.
flavor:
"When the bog walks, the wise run."
—Erissa, bog witch
originalText:
Protection from white
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Bog Elemental unless you sacrifice a land.

text:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice a land: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice a land: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.
name: Bog Glider

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

text:
Branded Brawlers can't attack if defending player controls an untapped land.
Branded Brawlers can't block if you control an untapped land.

"The sword or the lash. Choose."

originalText:
Branded Brawlers can't attack if defending player controls an untapped land.
Branded Brawlers can't block if you control an untapped land.

Brutal Suppression

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder texts.

text: Activated abilities of nontoken Rebels cost an additional "Sacrifice a land" to activate.
originalText: Activated abilities on Rebel cards cost an additional "Sacrifice a land" to play.
flavor:
"They no longer care about their own suffering. Show them something worse."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

name: Calming Verse

rulings.text: It checks if you control an untapped land during resolution.

text: Destroy all enchantments you don't control. Then, if you control an untapped land, destroy all enchantments you control.
originalText: Destroy all enchantments you don't control. Then, if you control an untapped land, destroy all enchantments you control.
flavor: The chattering forest fell silent as the otherworldly song began.

name: Celestial Convergence
text:
Celestial Convergence enters the battlefield with seven omen counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an omen counter from Celestial Convergence. If there are no omen counters on Celestial Convergence, the player with the highest life total wins the game. If two or more players are tied for highest life total, the game is a draw.
originalText:
Celestial Convergence comes into play with seven omen counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an omen counter from Celestial Convergence. If there are no omen counters on Celestial Convergence, the player with the highest life total wins the game. If two or more players are tied for highest life total, the game is a draw.

text:
{B}: Regenerate Chilling Apparition.
Whenever Chilling Apparition deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
flavor: Mortal minds shrivel at its touch.
originalText:
{B} Regenerate Chilling Apparition.
Whenever Chilling Apparition deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.
name: Chilling Apparition
Chimeric Idol

rulings.text: Your lands are tapped as part of the effect, not part of the cost.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

text: {0}: Tap all lands you control. Chimeric Idol becomes a 3/3 Turtle artifact creature until end of turn.
originalText: {0}: Tap all lands you control. Chimeric Idol becomes a 3/3 artifact creature until end of turn.
flavor: After a chimeric idol attacked them, the Keldons smashed all unfamiliar statues.

name: Citadel of Pain

rulings.text: It counts the untapped lands on resolution.

text: At the beginning of each player's end step, Citadel of Pain deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controls.
originalText: At the end of each player's turn, Citadel of Pain deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controls.
flavor:
"Battle is our religion. This fortress is our temple."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

text: Sacrifice a land: Coastal Hornclaw gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Jamuraan farmers fear three things above all else: droughts, floods, and hornclaws.
originalText: Sacrifice a land: Coastal Hornclaw gains flying until end of turn.
name: Coastal Hornclaw

text: Sacrifice two lands: Return Coffin Puppets from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if you control a Swamp.
flavor: The ground won't accept them.
originalText: Sacrifice two lands: Return Coffin Puppets to play. Play this ability only during your upkeep, only if Coffin Puppets is in your graveyard, and only if you control a swamp.
name: Coffin Puppets

rulings.text: The ability works even if you sacrifice your last swamp to activate it. It only checks for a swamp on activation.

text:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice X lands: Put X +1/+1 counters on Copper-Leaf Angel.
flavor:
"When Serra made angels, people called her a goddess. My angels are far superior to hers."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer
originalText:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice X lands: Put X +1/+1 counters on Copper-Leaf Angel.
name: Copper-Leaf Angel

rulings.text: X can be zero.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Darba unless you pay {G}{G}.
flavor: Legend has it the darba gave up its wings in return for an extra stomach.
originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Darba unless you pay {G}{G}.
name: Darba

text: Whenever Death Charmer deals combat damage to a creature, that creature's controller loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}.
flavor: It vents the chill of the grave.
originalText: Whenever Death Charmer deals combat damage to a creature, that creature's controller loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}.

Denying Wind
text: Search target player's library for up to seven cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
originalText: Search target player's library for up to seven cards and remove them from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

"The third wind of ascension is Eliminator, clearing Keld's path to victory."
—Keld Triumphant

name: Despoil
text: Destroy target land. Its controller loses 2 life.
originalText: Destroy target land. Its controller loses 2 life.
flavor: Nothing could grow where the vile smoke had been, and no one could breathe it and live.

name: Devastate
text: Destroy target land. Devastate deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText: Destroy target land. Devastate deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor:
"You're willing to die for your homeland. I'm willing to kill for it."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

text: Flying, vigilance
flavor:
To outrace the griffin
—Kipamu expression meaning
"to do the impossible"
originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Diving Griffin to tap.
name: Diving Griffin
Dual Nature

rulings.text: If Dual Nature leaves the battlefield between when it triggers and when a token is put onto the battlefield, that token remains on the battlefield indefinitely. It missed the separate ability which would have exiled the token.
If the original creature has any "enters the battlefield" abilities, the copy will also have those.
The token is not considered to have been kicked, even if the creature it's a copy of was kicked.

If a legendary creature enters the battlefield, the token is put onto the battlefield and then the "legend rule" forces its controller to put either the original or the token into its owner's graveyard before any player can take any actions.

text:
Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield, its controller puts a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield.
Whenever a nontoken creature leaves the battlefield, exile all tokens with the same name as that creature.
When Dual Nature leaves the battlefield, exile all tokens put onto the battlefield with Dual Nature.
originalText:
Whenever a creature card comes into play, its controller puts a creature token into play that's a copy of that creature.
Whenever a creature card leaves play, remove all tokens with the same name as that creature from the game.
When Dual Nature leaves play, remove all tokens created with it from the game.

name: Elephant Resurgence

rulings.text: The token creatures' power and toughness continuously adjust. They are not "locked in" when the spell resolves. This is because the tokens get an ability, rather than simply having their power and toughness set.

text: Each player puts a green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield. Those creatures have "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in its controller's graveyard."
originalText: Each player puts a green Elephant creature token into play. Those creatures have "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in its controller's graveyard."

name: Endbringer's Revel
text: {4}: Return target creature card from a graveyard to its owner's hand. Any player may activate this ability but only any time he or she could cast a sorcery.
originalText: {4}: Return target creature card from a graveyard to its owner's hand. Any player may play this ability but only any time he or she could play a sorcery.
flavor: First death. Then Shauku.

name: Entangler
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can block any number of creatures.
originalText: Enchanted creature may block any number of creatures.
flavor: "Tell me again," said Latulla, raising her fist, "how just one woman held back an entire Keldon platoon."

name: Excavation
text: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card. Any player may activate this ability.
originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card. Any player may play this ability.
flavor:
"There are secrets out there begging to be rediscovered. We just need to look in the right places."
—Teferi, planeswalker

name: Excise

rulings.text: The creature's controller gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

text: Exile target attacking creature unless its controller pays {X}.
originalText: Remove target attacking creature from the game unless its controller pays {X}.
flavor:
"Creation is no great feat. Anything you make, I can unmake in a heartbeat."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

text: Sacrifice a land: Fault Riders gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor: They turn geological upheaval into tactical advantage.
originalText: Sacrifice a land: Fault Riders gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

text: Fen Stalker has fear as long as you control no untapped lands. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: As silent as a shadow, and just as hard to flee.
originalText: Fen Stalker can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures as long as you control no untapped lands.

text: Whenever Fickle Efreet attacks or blocks, flip a coin at end of combat. If you lose the flip, an opponent gains control of Fickle Efreet.
flavor: Flame chooses its own course.
originalText: Whenever Fickle Efreet attacks or blocks, flip a coin at end of combat. If you lose the flip, an opponent gains control of Fickle Efreet.

Flameshot

rulings.text: You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

text:
You may discard a Mountain card rather than pay Flameshot's mana cost.
Flameshot deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.
originalText:
You may discard a mountain from your hand instead of paying Flameshot's mana cost.
Flameshot deals 3 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

name: Flay

rulings.text: The player gets to see the first discard before choosing whether or not to pay.
The player gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

text: Target player discards a card at random. Then that player discards another card at random unless he or she pays {1}.
originalText: Target player discards a card at random from his or her hand. Then that player discards another card at random from his or her hand unless he or she pays {1}.
flavor: The Keldons would never admit it, but Greel unsettles them, too.

name: Flowering Field

rulings.text: The land's controller gets to activate the ability.

text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."
originalText: Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."
flavor: Some lands are soothing, and their peace can be felt in the soul.

name: Foil
text:
You may discard an Island card and another card rather than pay Foil's mana cost.
Counter target spell.
originalText:
You may discard an island and another card from your hand instead of paying Foil's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a land card in your graveyard from the game. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

Heightened Awareness

As Heightened Awareness enters the battlefield, discard your hand.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
originalText:
As Heightened Awareness comes into play, discard your hand.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw a card.

"It startles me how alive one feels on the edge of death."

text: Hollow Warrior can't attack or block unless you tap an untapped creature you control not declared as an attacking or blocking creature this combat. (This cost is paid as attackers or blockers are declared.)

originalText: Hollow Warrior can't attack or block unless you tap an untapped creature you control. (This cost is paid as attackers or blockers are declared.)
name: Hollow Warrior

rulings.text: This card can't tap itself to allow itself to attack or block. You have to tap a different creature which is not being declared as an attacker or blocker.

name: Infernal Genesis

rulings.text: If the card has no mana cost (for instance, if it's a land), then its converted mana cost is 0. This means no tokens will be created.

text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then he or she puts X 1/1 black Minion creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that card's converted mana cost.
originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. He or she then puts X 1/1 black Minion creature tokens into play, where X is that card's converted mana cost.

name: Inflame
text: Inflame deals 2 damage to each creature dealt damage this turn.
originalText: Inflame deals 2 damage to each creature dealt damage this turn.
flavor: Wound, maim, kill: it's all the same to a Keldon.

text:
Flying
Sacrifice two lands: Jeweled Spirit gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.

text: You can't untap more than one land during your untap step.

originalText: You can't untap more than one land during your untap step.

text: {B}: Nakaya Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.

originalText: {B} Nakaya Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.

rulings.text: Each player gets the option to pay when the ability resolves.

name: Noxious Field

rulings.text: Land are normally colorless, so effects that care about the color of the damage's source will not find a color.

text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: This land deals 1 damage to each creature and each player."
originalText: Enchanted land has "{T}: This land deals 1 damage to each creature and each player."
flavor: Ultimately, it became a three-way battle: the land attacked both armies.

name: Outbreak
text:
You may discard a Swamp card rather than pay Outbreak's mana cost.
Choose a creature type. All creatures of that type get -1/-1 until end of turn.
originalText:
You may discard a swamp from your hand instead of paying Outbreak's mana cost.
Choose a creature type. All creatures of that type get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: This plague chooses its victims.

name: Overburden
text: Whenever a player puts a nontoken creature onto the battlefield, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.
originalText: Whenever a player puts a creature card into play, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.
flavor: The Kipamu League knew what Keld refused to acknowledge: the land could support no more.

name: Panic Attack
text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
originalText: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.

name: Pit Raptor
text:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Pit Raptor unless you pay {2}{B}{B}.
originalText:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Pit Raptor unless you pay {2}{B}{B}.

text: Whenever Plague Fiend deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature unless its controller pays {2}.

originalText: Whenever Plague Fiend deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature unless its controller pays {2}.
name: Plague Fiend

rulings.text: The creature's controller gets the option to pay when the triggered ability resolves.

name: Plague Wind
text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
originalText: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—Keld Triumphant

name: Psychic Theft

rulings.text: The card is revealed to all players while it is exiled.
You can cast the instant or sorcery during the End step after you put the "at the beginning of the end step" trigger on the stack, as long as you do so before that trigger resolves.
The card may only be cast once. Once it is announced and put on the stack, the card is no longer exiled and the effect of Psychic Theft ends.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from it and exile that card. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. At the beginning of the next end step, if you haven't cast the card, return it to its owner's hand.
originalText: Look at target player's hand, choose an instant or sorcery card from it, and remove that card from the game. You may play the card as though it were in your hand as long as the card remains removed from the game. At end of turn, if you haven't played the card, return it to its owner's hand.

text: Trample
flavor: As a rite of passage, Kipamu youths taunt razorbacks with long sticks . . . then flee.
originalText: Trample
name: Pygmy Razorback

text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Return Quicksilver Wall to its owner's hand. Any player may activate this ability.

(Walls can't attack.)

text:
Rebel Informer can't be the target of white spells or abilities from white sources.

rulings.text: The spell's controller gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.
originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.
flavor: "Are you sure you want to do that?"

text: Whenever one or more creatures attack you, if Reveille Squad is untapped, you may untap all creatures you control.
flavor: "To arms! To arms! The Lion roars!"
originalText: Whenever you're attacked, if Reveille Squad is untapped, you may untap all creatures you control.
name: Reveille Squad
Rhystic Cave

rulings.text: If a player pays {1}, Rhystic Cave does not produce any mana, but is still considered to have been tapped for mana. Things which trigger of the land being tapped for mana will trigger, but things which try to replace mana production will have nothing to replace.
Each player (starting with the current player and going in turn order) gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

The card's ability has errata so you can't activate the ability during casting of a spell or activating of an ability. This prevents you from getting into a position where someone paying {1} could stop you from having enough mana to pay for the spell. If you want to use it pay for a spell or ability, you need to use this card before you start the casting or activating.

text: {T}: Choose a color. Add one mana of that color to your mana pool unless any player pays {1}. Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.
originalText: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool unless any player pays {1}.
flavor:
"All mages dip into the same well; some are just in more of a hurry."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Rhystic Circle

rulings.text: Can't be used to prevent damage to your creatures, just to you.

text: {1}: Any player may pay {1}. If no one does, the next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
originalText: {1}: Any player may pay {1}. If no one does, the next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor: The circle buys time—an important commodity in battle.

name: Rhystic Deluge

rulings.text: The creature's controller gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

text: {U}: Tap target creature unless its controller pays {1}.
originalText: {U} Tap target creature unless its controller pays {1}.

name: Rhystic Lightning

rulings.text: The player gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

originalText: Rhystic Lightning deals 4 damage to target creature or player unless that creature's controller or that player pays {2}. If he or she does, Rhystic Lightning deals 2 damage to the creature or player.

name: Rhystic Scrying

rulings.text: Each player (starting with the current player and going in turn order) gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

text: Draw three cards. Then, if any player pays {2}, discard three cards.
originalText: Draw three cards. Then, if any player pays {2}, discard three cards from your hand.

"The trick is to ask when no one's listening."

name: Rhystic Shield

rulings.text: Only affects creatures you control when it resolves.
Each player (starting with the current player and going in turn order) gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

text: Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn. They get an additional +0/+2 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.
originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn. They get an additional +0/+2 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.
flavor: A shield for one is good. A shield for everyone is even better.

name: Rhystic Study

rulings.text: The player gets the option to pay when this triggered ability resolves. This will be after the spell is announced, but before it resolves.
You don't have to decide whether or not you are drawing until after the player decides whether or not to pay.

text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {1}.
originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {1}.

name: Rhystic Syphon
text: Unless target player pays {3}, he or she loses 5 life and you gain 5 life.
originalText: Unless target player pays {3}, he or she loses 5 life and you gain 5 life.
flavor: Jamuraan wizards are linked together by magic, a bond that only the wicked dare exploit.

text: Unless any player pays {2}, search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.
originalText: Unless any player pays {2}, search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

originalText: Basic lands each player controls can't be the targets of spells or abilities as long as that player controls three or fewer lands.
